Zac Blanco

Student and Aspiring Engineer

I'm currently a commiter on the Apache Knox Project. I believe security is a critical part of the Hadoop ecosystem and Knox helps to provide that functionality. You can see the my projects page for my other projects on GitHub.

I am Currently a student studying Computer Science and Computer Engineering at Rutgers University, The State University of New Jersey, New Brunswick. Expected Graduation: 2018.

Activities

I enjoy running, biking, hiking, swimming, camping, and just about anything that gets me active. I always like trying new things! I do my best to lead a healthy and active lifestyle.

Professional Experience

I've worked for numerous companies filling technology roles. Previously I worked as a developer at Drivers History Inc. My most recent position was at Hortonworks serving as a software engineer helping to develop enterprise grade security for the Hadoop platform through Apache Knox.

To find my resume, projects, LinkedIn an other information about me you can read the About page found at the top of this website. Also, take a look at my blog page which I try to maintain regularly and update regularly with new content!
